Player History
Signed as a free agent by Toronto on 4/1/1985 to a minor league deal...
Injured on 4/4/1985 with a Pulled Elbow Ligament, out for one week...
Traded from Toronto to Chicago on 7/31/1985 (Going to CHC: 1B Cecil Fielder, 3B Mike Sharperson, CF Ruppert Jones. Going to TOR: P Floyd Bannister, P Ron Davis, CF Keith Moreland)...
Injured on 7/7/1987 with a Sore Shoulder, out for 1-2 weeks...
Had first career hit on 9/9/1987, off Britt Burns (NYM)...
Hit first career homerun on 9/12/1987, off Sid Fernandez (NYM)...
2/2/1990: Gets a new one-year contract worth $810,000 through salary arbitration...
2/2/1991: Gets a new one-year contract worth $810,000 through salary arbitration...
2/2/1992: Gets a new one-year contract worth $810,000 through salary arbitration...
Won World Series with Chicago in 1992...
Signed as a free agent by Kansas City on 2/22/1993 to a 2-year deal worth $850,000 per year...
